column1: Newborn screening tests look for developmental, genetic, and metabolic disorders in the newborn baby.
The most thorough screening panel checks for about 40 disorders.
However, because phenylketonuria (PKU) was the first disorder for which a screening test developed, some people still call the newborn screen "the PKU test".
The oximeter will measure the baby's oxygen levels in the hand and foot.
If follow-up testing confirms that the child has a disease, treatment can be started, before symptoms appear.
